title: Ex-BHS owner Dominic Chappell denies cheating the taxman
text:
Dominic Chappell, the serial bankrupt and former owner of BHS, has denied avoiding paying half a billion pounds in tax.

Mr Chappell fell into disrepute after he bought BHS for £1 from retail tycoon Sir Philip Green a year before it collapsed. He pleaded not guilty at a court hearing on Friday.

He denied three tax evasion charges alleging he failed to register Swiss Rock, his bankrupt finance company, for taxes from the correct date, gave false information to the taxman, did not declare profits and failed to submit VAT returns.

The offences are said to have taken place between January 2014 and September 2016. He first appeared in court in June.
